intro: Galium arkansanum var. pubiflorum, commonly known as the Arkansas bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded, rich soils. Its foliage and flowers are typically covered with fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
